content:
• Wednesday, September 21, 2011
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller's (NASDAQ:MLHR) FQ1 earnings easily beat estimates as profits soar 53% on solid...

    Herman Miller's (NASDAQ:MLHR) FQ1 earnings easily beat estimates as profits soar 53% on solid revenue growth. Margins improved significantly, primarily due to price increases instituted in May and higher production output. Shares +11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • BAC

    A worse performer in the financials than Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and Citigroup (NYSE:C) since...

    A worse performer in the financials than Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and Citigroup (NYSE:C) since markets began falling in late July? Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS), which fell 8.6% today to a new 52-week low. Its decline over the last 7 weeks comes to 42%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • RHT

    More on Red Hat's (NYSE:RHT) FQ2 results: Deferred revenue reached $813M, up 3% Q/Q and $27M...

    More on Red Hat's (NYSE:RHT) FQ2 results: Deferred revenue reached $813M, up 3% Q/Q and $27M Q/Q. Operating cash flow was $77.1M, up 20% Y/Y. Subscriptions accounted for 85% of revenue, and training/services 15%. R&D expenses were 18.3% of revenue, down from 19.2% in year-ago period. RHT +4.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL -3%) is trading lower into the close after saying earlier it had agreed to settle...

    Mylan (MYL -3%) is trading lower into the close after saying earlier it had agreed to settle with Hoffman La Roche to resolve litigation related to its XELODA tablets, a treatment for cancer known generically as Capecitabine. The terms of the settlement are not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • FDX

    FedEx (FDX -2.2%) falls after getting triple-teamed by analysts. Morgan Keegan and Sterne Agee...

    FedEx (FDX -2.2%) falls after getting triple-teamed by analysts. Morgan Keegan and Sterne Agee both cut their price target on shares to $115, while UBS weighed in even lower with a $106 PT on concern about the slowing global economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG) is up 9.8% after Craig-Hallum starts coverage on the chipmaker with...

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG) is up 9.8% after Craig-Hallum starts coverage on the chipmaker with a Buy rating and $9 PT. In addition, the company announced today that Sony (NYSE:SNE) will be using Silicon Image's InstaPort technology in its Bravia TVs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • TNH

    Shares of Terra Nitrogen (TNH -11.2%) sink for the 2nd straight day, falling much harder than...

    Shares of Terra Nitrogen (TNH -11.2%) sink for the 2nd straight day, falling much harder than other fertilizer stocks. The enticing dividend yield of 9.9% could be a trap, given the company has already reduced its payout to $3.75 from $4.84 earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 8 Comments
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG -1.7%) is lower today after Stifel Nicolaus initiates the shares with a weak...

    EOG Resources (EOG -1.7%) is lower today after Stifel Nicolaus initiates the shares with a weak hold. Stifel says the company is outspending its cash flow too fast to achieve meaningful growth, and liquids growth will decelerate due to acreage expiration issues in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM

  • Gold takes a dive in the wake of the Fed statement, falling nearly 2% or $35, now trading at...

    Gold takes a dive in the wake of the Fed statement, falling nearly 2% or $35, now trading at $1,789/oz., -1.1% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +0.8%) holds on to gains after RBC initates the shares with an...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +0.8%) holds on to gains after RBC initates the shares with an outperform and a price target of $9. The company is one of the largest players in the Bakken oil fields and should benefit from from a planned boost in production.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA) is down 10.8%, and Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) is down 1.6%, after a jury found...

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA) is down 10.8%, and Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) is down 1.6%, after a jury found the companies guilty of infringing each others' patents, but awarded Medtronic far more in damages. However, Jefferies remains bullish on NuVasive, predicting market share gains for the company's XLIF spinal procedure will allow it to beat guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM

  • After struggling to get going, 30-year bonds now looking to move higher - +1% to 142-26. 10-year...

    After struggling to get going, 30-year bonds now looking to move higher - +1% to 142-26. 10-year notes +0.2% to 130-24. 10-year yield of 1.871% lowest in more than 60 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +14.2%) has taken off on news that the Department of Veterans...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +14.2%) has taken off on news that the Department of Veterans Affairs has dropped Roche's Avastin drug, a rival to Regeneron's Eylea, on blindness and infection concerns. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • ASEI

    American Science and Engineering (ASEI +1.4%) gains after saying it's received a $2.3M order...

    American Science and Engineering (ASEI +1.4%) gains after saying it's received a $2.3M order from the U.S. government for the service and maintenance of its ZBV Military Trailers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +1.5%) gains on positive comments out of Morgan Stanley this morning. The...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +1.5%) gains on positive comments out of Morgan Stanley this morning. The firm says the shares have continued to outperform, even through the market peak in July and subsequent sell off. Additionally, the company's Model S preview event in October should generate positive press coverage and lead to higher sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • EHC

    HealthSouth (HLS -6.2%) says that if President Obama's proposed cuts to rehabilitation hospitals...

    HealthSouth (HLS -6.2%) says that if President Obama's proposed cuts to rehabilitation hospitals under his deficit-reduction plan had been in effect for the most recent compliance testing period, the rebalancing of the Medicare discharge mix would have reduced its net operating revenues by approximately $42M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • MNST

    Hansen Natural (HANS) is up 1.6% after UBS reiterates a Buy, predicting the company's Monster...

    Hansen Natural (HANS) is up 1.6% after UBS reiterates a Buy, predicting the company's Monster energy drink line will continue posting double-digit growth through 2013. It also expects Hansen as a whole to average 20.5% annual earnings growth over the next 3 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSX

    CSX takes a -6.8% hit after the Senate Appropriations subcommittee - a panel controlled by...

    CSX takes a -6.8% hit after the Senate Appropriations subcommittee - a panel controlled by fellow Democrats - approved legislation yesterday that leaves President Obama's high-speed passenger rail initiative unfunded next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • RIO

    It's another bad day for copper: Prices fall 2.2% to $3.73/lb, marking the low since November as...

    It's another bad day for copper: Prices fall 2.2% to $3.73/lb, marking the low since November as the miners can't seem to escape bad news (I, II) on the production front either. Decliners: RIO -2.2%, FCX -4.1%, BHP -2.8%, FM -4.5%, SCCO -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    With the Apotheker firing leak looking like it has legs, Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +11.3%) leaps even...

    With the Apotheker firing leak looking like it has legs, Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +11.3%) leaps even higher on a Bloomberg report the board is reconsidering a plan to spin off the PC business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • GSK

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +12.6%) pops on positive comments from Piper Jaffray, saying sales...

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +12.6%) pops on positive comments from Piper Jaffray, saying sales for Benlysta, a drug for the treatment of lupus, rose 33% in August. Piper believes the data coincides with the company's claim that physicians are getting more comfortable with reimbursement issues and writing prescriptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • OPTR

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (OPTR +3.8%) trades up after BMC initiates the shares with a buy. The...

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (OPTR +3.8%) trades up after BMC initiates the shares with a buy. The firm says the company's newly launched antibiotic, Dificid, will exceed sales expectations in both the near and longer term.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • NKTR

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +6.7%) gets a lift after saying it will present positive...

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +6.7%) gets a lift after saying it will present positive proof-of-concept data from its first Phase 1 clinical trial of NKTR-181 at the American Academy of Pain Management's 22nd Annual Clinical Meeting.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHTR

    Time Warner Cable (TWC +1.8%) is catching a bid after President Rob Marcus claims subscriber...

    Time Warner Cable (TWC +1.8%) is catching a bid after President Rob Marcus claims subscriber growth has improved in Q3, with Internet additions growing and video losses declining. Time Warner, which lost 130K video subscribers in Q2, attributes the improvement to better marketing and customer segmentation efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • LTM

    Brazilian airliners TAM (TAM +3.8%) and Gol Linhas (GOL +2.6%) are solid gainers after reports...

    Brazilian airliners TAM (TAM +3.8%) and Gol Linhas (GOL +2.6%) are solid gainers after reports surface indicating each company is close to receiving approval from regulators for a merger - Tam with Chile's LAB and Gol Linhas with Webjet Linhas Aereas SA.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • MPWR

    Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR -1.3%) cuts guidance, saying Q3 sales will now be between $52M to...

    Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR -1.3%) cuts guidance, saying Q3 sales will now be between $52M to $54M, below Street estimates of $56M. The company says it's slowing down its channel inventory to reflect a weaker business climate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (WMB +1.6%) will spend up to $400M to expand its Louisiana production facility, as...

    Williams Cos. (WMB +1.6%) will spend up to $400M to expand its Louisiana production facility, as an overwhelming supply of cheap natural gas continues to give incentive for investment in U.S. petrochemical production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • CAB

    Cabela's (CAB -5.1%) falls after JPMorgan Chase downgrades shares to Underweight from Neutral....

    Cabela's (CAB -5.1%) falls after JPMorgan Chase downgrades shares to Underweight from Neutral. The company also took a PR hit this week after it misposted online a price for one of its products at $4.88 (instead of $210) - then compounded the error by revealing customers' e-mail addresses en masse in a reply to the debacle.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • AOL

    Shares of AOL fall 7% after CEO Tim Armstrong's rallying speech seems to have fallen flat....

    Shares of AOL fall 7% after CEO Tim Armstrong's rallying speech seems to have fallen flat. Investors calling for a merger with Yahoo (YHOO -0.9%) to save the day may be disappointed after Arianna Huffington issues a quasi-denial a deal is in the works.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +5%) shooting higher on chatter the board is considering ousting CEO Leo...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +5%) shooting higher on chatter the board is considering ousting CEO Leo Apotheker, who has been on the job only since November 2010. A source says board member and former eBay chief Meg Whitman could be the replacement. The board has plans to meet this afternoon.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • RRC

    Shares of oil & gas developer Range Resources (RRC +12.7%), which surged on Monday thanks to...

    Shares of oil & gas developer Range Resources (RRC +12.7%), which surged on Monday thanks to takeover rumors, have spiked higher again over the last hour, on strong volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Add Vivus (VVUS +4.1%) to the list of companies showing a gain on speculation that demand for...

    Add Vivus (VVUS +4.1%) to the list of companies showing a gain on speculation that demand for obesity drugs will take off following Orexigen's (OREX +52%) restart on development of Contrave. The momentum buying looks to be led by loose talk the FDA will ease obesity drug standards, which doesn't quite fall in line with analysts and the agency itself (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ITT

    ITT is trading down -1.8% after announcing a $100M buyback of its long-term debt as it seeks to...

    ITT is trading down -1.8% after announcing a $100M buyback of its long-term debt as it seeks to placate bondholders before splitting into three publicly traded companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal companies (KOL -3.1%) are getting clobbered after Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -7.6%) and...

    Coal companies (KOL -3.1%) are getting clobbered after Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -7.6%) and Walter Energy (WLT -10.3%) warn that output for steelmaking coal will fall short of expectations. Rivals are down: PCX -9.2%, ACI -7.5%, BTU -4.7%, CNX -2.8%. The warning also is whacking railroad stocks: NSC -6.9%, CSX -6.8%, UNP -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC +0.3%) may feel some collateral damage from the blowup in shares of Pacific...

    Intel (INTC +0.3%) may feel some collateral damage from the blowup in shares of Pacific Biosciences (PACB -18.9%). An investment report from the chipmaker lists the biotech company as one of its corporate investments.(.pdf).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -7.1%) is the worst-performing S&P 500 stock, as Collins Stewart notes the...

    First Solar (FSLR -7.1%) is the worst-performing S&P 500 stock, as Collins Stewart notes the bad timing for the company's three projects scheduled to receive federal loan guarantees by the end of the month amid the Congressional probe into federal-backed loans for Solyndra and other alt-energy firms. A rejection of loan guarantees to FSLR could have a "material negative impact" on earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAB

    Cabela's (CAB -4.4%) trades down after being cut by J.P. Morgan to underweight. The firm says...

    Cabela's (CAB -4.4%) trades down after being cut by J.P. Morgan to underweight. The firm says sales in credit card unit, which has been the primary driver of EPS growth until now, appears to be flattening.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • BWA

    Companies related to manufacturing parts for the auto industry are taking it on the chin today,...

    Companies related to manufacturing parts for the auto industry are taking it on the chin today, as the outlook for strong sales weakens. Copart's Q4 report pointing to slimmer margins may have kickstarted the negative sentiment on the sector. Can BWA -3.8%, LEA -3.6%, CPRT -3.2%, MTOR -2.5% and DAN -3.1% survive slumping auto sales?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) gains 6.9% after J.P. Morgan upgrades the CAD software giant to...

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) gains 6.9% after J.P. Morgan upgrades the CAD software giant to Overweight. Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI), a provider of content protection and program guide software, is up 5.6% on a similar upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • AAWW

    Atlas Air (AAWW -8.5%) is lower this morning after Suntrust cut the shares to neutral over...

    Atlas Air (AAWW -8.5%) is lower this morning after Suntrust cut the shares to neutral over concerns that fewer clients are renewing after the expiration of their 2012 leases, and signs the company is cannibalizing its fleet.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • S

    Shares of Sprint (S +3.3%) move higher as the company tweaks some of its policies in advance of...

    Shares of Sprint (S +3.3%) move higher as the company tweaks some of its policies in advance of a rumored iPhone offering (4 or 5?). The carrier will shorten its return policy to 14 days from 40 days and discontinue its Premier Program, as it looks to monetize the built-in loyalty of iPhone owners.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +3.8%) is rebounding a little from yesterday's 15% drop, triggered by fears of...

    Sina (SINA +3.8%) is rebounding a little from yesterday's 15% drop, triggered by fears of censorship demands, and of new regulations on firms listed overseas. iChinaStock gives a list of reasons why the fears are overblown, including China's interest in supporting foreign investment, and the experience of Chinese firms in dealing with government censors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • PACB

    Shares of Pacific Biosciences (PACB -13.1%) fall hard after the firm announces a 28% reduction...

    Shares of Pacific Biosciences (PACB -13.1%) fall hard after the firm announces a 28% reduction of its workforce in consideration to the "economic environement." Piper Jaffray and JPMorgan both downgraded shares today to Neutral and Underweight, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • CXS

    CreXus (NYSE:CXS) knocks out a 4.5% gain on the open after the firm declares a $0.30 dividend to...

    CreXus (NYSE:CXS) knocks out a 4.5% gain on the open after the firm declares a $0.30 dividend to shareholders, pushing up the yield on the REIT to an eye-catching 13.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) is up 4.8% after Roth's Nathan Schneiderman upgrades the data...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) is up 4.8% after Roth's Nathan Schneiderman upgrades the data warehousing software firm to Buy, believing its recent selloff is overdone. As with QLIK (previously), Schneiderman is encouraged by ORCL and ADBE's results, and he also liked the "surprisingly bullish" tone struck by Informatica's CEO during a recent presentation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Dahlman Rose recommends investors take advantage of yesterday's thrashing in Molycorp's (MCP...

    Dahlman Rose recommends investors take advantage of yesterday's thrashing in Molycorp's (MCP +4.7%) shares by buying. "Despite the fall in rare earth prices, we continue to see substantial margins and earnings power." The firm reiterates their $120 target, nearly triple today's price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoran (FCX -2.8%) says an ongoing labor dispute at an Indonesian mine will cut into...

    Freeport McMoran (FCX -2.8%) says an ongoing labor dispute at an Indonesian mine will cut into this quarter's sales numbers, as it approximates 3M-5M pounds of copper and 5K ounces of gold production per day will be lost.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • OREX

    While Orexigen (OREX +68%) has reason to feel good about restarting development of its rejected...

    While Orexigen (OREX +68%) has reason to feel good about restarting development of its rejected obesity drug Contrave, the path to approval remains pockmarked with risk and expense. With the FDA asking for an almost unprecedented 10K-patient safety study, Adam Feurstein says 2015-2016 (vs. OREX's 2014) is a more realistic timeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) is up 11%, and AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) up 2%, after...

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) is up 11%, and AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) up 2%, after Allos discloses it's received a $2.20/share offer to acquire the company, though it warns its board has not recommended the proposal. AMAG's planned buyout of Allos has been threatened by shareholder opposition following MSMB Capital's offer for AMAG.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • OREX

    Premarket gainers: OREX +66%. ALTH +15%. ARNA +9%. ORCL +5%. ADBE +5%. HLS +5%. CS +4%. MCP +4%....

    Premarket gainers: OREX +66%. ALTH +15%. ARNA +9%. ORCL +5%. ADBE +5%. HLS +5%. CS +4%. MCP +4%. ALU +3%. YRCW +3%.
    Losers: WLT -13%. ANR -10%. PCX -5%. ACI -5%. NUVA -4%. BTU -4%. -3%. TCK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SCGLY

    The large French banks have moved from down sharply to green in the past 30 minutes. Rumors are...

    The large French banks have moved from down sharply to green in the past 30 minutes. Rumors are making the rounds that the government may force a merger or recapitalization of the lenders. The CAC 40 has moved to nearly flat, from -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • ORCL

    Goldman Sachs weighs in on Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) following its FQ1 report with a Buy rating and a...

    Goldman Sachs weighs in on Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) following its FQ1 report with a Buy rating and a $35 PT on shares. After the company guided November license growth above the high end of expectations, Goldman revised FY12, FY13 and FY14 EPS guidance upwards by 4%, 6% and 7% respectively. Shares of ORCL are up 3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • WLT

    Keep an eye on Market Vectors Coal ETF (NYSEARCA:KOL) following weak guidance from WLT (-10.7%)...

    Keep an eye on Market Vectors Coal ETF (NYSEARCA:KOL) following weak guidance from WLT (-10.7%) and ANR (-11.2%). WLT is a pure-play met coal producer, and ANR cited soft met coal shipments to Asia amid a surprising dip in customer activity. Also in play: BTU, PCX, CLF, ACI, JRCC, CNX.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) gains 14% premarket after rival Orexigen (NASDAQ:OREX) looks...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) gains 14% premarket after rival Orexigen (NASDAQ:OREX) looks set to gain clearance to introduce the first new obesity medicine in the U.S. over the last ten years. The company had its own experimental diet drug rejected last October on safety worries.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Shares of Alpha Natural (ANR) fall 6.6% premarket after the firm lowers its estimate for 2011...

    Shares of Alpha Natural (ANR) fall 6.6% premarket after the firm lowers its estimate for 2011 coal production to 102.5M tons from 109.5M, and says it will "refine" its 2012 outlook when it reports Q3 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • OREX

    Shares of microcap Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) are up 73% premarket after the firm...

    Shares of microcap Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) are up 73% premarket after the firm announces a meeting with the FDA led to a "clear and feasible" path for its Contrave drug to meet approval to treat obesity.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) wins a $101M damages award in a patent lawsuit against NuVasive...

    Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) wins a $101M damages award in a patent lawsuit against NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA) related to technology on spinal surgey products. Shares of MDT +2.2% in premarket trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM
